data.title: Future Roads: Safer Roads Start Here
data.meta_description: GM Future Roads aims to create safer roads for all with Safety View by GM Future Roads & INRIX. Learn more about Safety View and how it helps communities reach safety goals.
data.text:
Data-Driven Change

Traffic crashes are a leading cause of death in the United States, and pedestrians and cyclists account for more than half of these fatalities.

Together, GM Future Roads and INRIX are leveraging near real-time data to help transportation professionals pinpoint dangerous roads, prioritize high-impact solutions and create actionable plans for accelerated implementation and funding.

Proprietary data—

powerful results

Safety View brings together unique assets to provide hyper-local insights on communities and the roads that shape them. GM Future Roads works with The University of Michigan Transportation Research Institute (UMTRI) on data validation of the Safety View Risk Score, and other data sets within the Safety View tool.

Our proprietary datasets like crash data, road system context, time-based volume estimates and vulnerable road users allow communities to accurately:

Pinpoint dangerous roads and intersections

Prioritize high-impact solutions

Plan for accelerated implementation and funding

Our commitment

to road safety

GM’s vision is a world with zero crashes, zero emissions and zero congestion, and we’re committed to making this vision a reality. GM Future Roads is our way of addressing these issues with breakthrough technology and industry-leading innovation.

We’re in the midst of a new transportation era with the emergence of extensive data sets and powerful analytics capabilities, and GM Future Roads seeks to lead this dynamic evolution of Intelligent Transportation Systems (ITS) to provide actionable data for transportation planning.

We all share the road; let’s make it safer.
